rules.natural: If the water source contains alcohol, then it is a conservation priority.
Provided that there is agricultural runoff into the water source, wildlife is affected by it.
Either there is agricultural runoff into the water source or there is industrial discharge into it.
Either government intervention occurs regarding the water source or, under the condition that there is industrial discharge, the water source is not safe for drinking.
If there is community action concerning the water source, then it is not the case that government intervention occurs.
Provided that chemical testing is done on the water source, biological testing is conducted as well.
If a policy change occurs regarding the water source, then regulation is enforced for it.
Under the condition that there is a policy change concerning the water source, there is a budget increase for it.
If habitat loss occurs due to the water source, then it does not have an economic impact.
Provided that there is a biodiversity decline from the water source, it does not have an economic impact.
Either the water source receives international attention or, under the condition of an ecological crisis, habitat loss or biodiversity decline happens.
Either research is initiated on the water source or expert consultation is sought for it.
Provided that expert consultation is sought for the water source, there is no budget increase for it.
If findings are published about the water source, then it is not the case that there is a budget increase for it.
Whenever an investigation is launched for the water source, an alert is issued for it.
If it is not the case that a comprehensive assessment implies that biological testing leads to ecosystem damage or conservation priority, then a policy change occurs.
Under the condition that a comprehensive assessment does not imply that biological testing results in ecosystem damage or conservation priority, there is an economic impact.
If it is not true that research initiation leads to findings being published, then alternative sources are available.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(monitoring_active(water_source) -> (-(-(contains(substance, water_source) | contains(alcohol, water_source)) -> polluted(water_source)) -> cleanup_required(water_source))) -> investigation_launched(water_source))
rules.natural: If the implication that monitoring is active leads to the condition that not having neither substance nor alcohol causing pollution necessitates cleanup does not hold, then an investigation is launched.
If there is no community action concerning the water source, then legal proceedings are underway.
Provided that there is no community action regarding the water source, legal proceedings do not occur.
Under the condition that the water source is not a conservation priority, it is safe for drinking.

(A11 → ¬A8).natural: Whenever there is industrial discharge into the water source, it is not safe for drinking.

(A19 → A20).natural: If a policy change occurs regarding the water source, then regulation is enforced for it.

(A22 → ¬A21).natural: If habitat loss occurs due to the water source, then it does not have an economic impact.
